Reviews.Title: “Clean, but not enough staff”
Reviews.Author: chadb114
Reviews.Content: The person at the front desk was very helpful, but very overworked. The hotel was pretty full for the weekend, and yet only one desk person and NO housekeeping. At 8 pm the pool was out of pool towels, and she did not have more since housekeeping had left for the night. We had to use our room towels. When my daughter reacted to the chlorine in the pool (she has sensitive skin) I had to take her to take a shower, and we had to wait for 15 minutes in the lobby to get towels for our room. We were still pretty wet from the pool, and it was February and pretty cold when the door kept opening. We got a few towels, but the line was growing for room towels. A while later my husband went to get more towels for the rest of the family, and they only had 2 left and plenty of people still needing them, and still no housekeeping. We also had a smoke detector in our room with no batteries, and had to keep going back to get pillows and blankets for the pullout couch. Again, the woman at the desk was very professional and courteous, but there was only so much she could do. For a full hotel on a holiday weekend, there should have been more staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the Superbowl!”
Reviews.Author: andrea
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at this property as I was attending the Superbowl. It was certainly understandable that the hotel was extremely expensive and packed to capacity but the hotel management and staff seemed to have everything under control and handled it well. The room was a nice size and clean. The breakfast was fine. The location in proximity to downtown Indy was perfect. Overall, if I ever have a need to go to this area or if my team plays in the Superbowl for which it is in Indy, I will definitely stay at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great choice!”
Reviews.Author: meezer3
Reviews.Content: I have come to depend on this site more and more before I book any hotels for my trips. So when planning a trip to Indianapolis for the first time I came here first to look for the best place to stay. Location and price were my first concerns. There were several good hotels to choose from but this one seemed to be the best all around choice. We were visiting friends, plus attending a event at the Fairgrounds and this seemed to fill the bill. We were planning on checking in a little later than normal so I called ahead that day to make sure that wouldn't be a problem. The gentleman who answered assured me that they would be holding our room for us. Later When ready to check in we found the hotel easily and within close proximity to our friends home. When greeted at the desk at check in everything was pre-set for us and check in went very quickly. The lobby was very nice, and it seemed the building was rather new, I'm thinking probably no more than 5-7 years old. We were placed on the fourth floor, but there was a convienent elevator just down the hallway from the front desk. I liked that we were higher up as it seemed quieter, even with our room being to the front of the building. The room far exceeded our expectations. Very nicely appointed, with large closet, complete with iron, ironing board, wash basket and safe. The bathroom was adequate and very clean with the usual soap, body cream, shampoo, etc. Next to the closet was a microwave and small refrigerator, with coffee maker and supplies, two bottles of water and some nut bars. The room was laid out more like a small apartment with very good use of space. A large and comfortable King size bed was close to the window with flat screen TV and Blu ray player. The front part of the room closest to the bath had a longe chair with ottoman, small end table with magazines and writing desk with online hookup there. A notebook gave you all the info needed to access their Internet system. Decorations were done very tastefully with many pillows on the bed and a down comforter. I liked the idea they didn't use a bedspread, as those can be seldom washed and I always fold those back completely and put out of the way. Their TV offered a assortment of options: games, recent movies, childrens programing, and your standard TV. The movies were a little pricey ($10.99) so we opted not to view them. There was breakfast offered in the morning but we opted not to use it. A also added bonus was that they also accepted our AARP discount so the cost to stay here was very good. The following morning it was easy to access the Interstate and also gas up before getting on the road to head for home. For a one night stay I was sorry I wasn't going to stay longer. This is the second Wyndham hotel we have stayed at in a month and they certainly are making "believers" out of us.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden Gem with personal touch”
Reviews.Author: LittleBread
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a choice for a business trip. The hotel was easy to access, clean, quiet, and very comfortable. The reason I rated it excellent was due to the owners of the hotel. The owners put on a happy hour three times a week where you can get drinks and popcorn. This is always a good touch but once a week the owners cook a meal to be served for happy hour. The owners actually do the cooking and serving of the meal. They served pulled pork that was better than what I could get at a local restaurant that specializes in BBQ. Personal touch, and a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Lydia B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I finally had an overnight to celebrate our 7 year wedding anniversary...a month late to say the least. We were finally going to have about 24 hours free from young children...ahh the bliss of peace and quiet! I had asked the hotel to if they could have a goodie basket with dark chocolates etc as a gift for my husband and they could charge it to my room. They said no problem. When we arrived, it was an easy check in and the front desk clerk was very polite and helful. Our room was very accommodating and clean. Our room also had the requested chocolates-wonderful selection from a local Indianapolis chocolate business, Best Chocolate in Town. VERY Delicious! We enjoyed our time in the hotel pool and whirlpool...all clean and clean towels available at pool side. Sometimes we find this a problem at other hotels but not here. The room was very roomy and nice with the jacuzzi suite. Again VERY CLEAN! No mildew or mold in the bathroom. THANK YOU! We've stayed at several 4 and 5 star hotels and have found mildew and mold in the bathrooms as well as holes in the tiles, etc. It was very refreshing that we didn't have worry about anything during this relaxing visit! Of course, breakfast was hot and fresh. Thanks, Jim Olson, for wonderful getaway. Your Wingate by Wyndham was over the top!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: ChristiCN
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for one night for a family member's 80th birthday. Our extended family had multiple rooms and they arranged for us to all be on the same floor. Very clean property, wonderful breakfast, large rooms with lots of space. Friendly and helpful staff. Only issue we had was a broken pool chair which caused a fall - no serious injuries thank goodness!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: gjl_29
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Wingate by Wyndham 9/29-10/3/2011. I had a good experience. My flight came in early and I was able to check in at 12:30pm as oppose to waiting until 3:00pm. I originally requested a top floor room - I didn't like the smell of the 4th floor hallway when I got there. I asked the front desk clerk for another room on the main floor - which smelled much better. He was happy to change it for me. The room was a nice size - 2 queen beds, desk, lounge chair, flat screen tv, mini fridge, microwave, and safe. The bathroom was clean - however there was no fan in the bathroom. The breakfast was minimal - coffee, dry cereal, some scrambled eggs, etc. They did have a waffle maker - which is fine if you like that sort of thing. Its not the filling up breakfast - just more of the "on the go" type thing. The location of the hotel is a little off the beaten path - there is a mini shopping center with a Starbucks and Quizno's there. There was a Bob Evans across the way - but not walking distance. I ended up traveling a few exits down to Cracker Barrel, Fridays, Chillis - and also a Target. The checkout was very easy. The staff was friendly. Of the 4 nights I stayed they did not clean my room just one time when I was there, and I believe it was just a miscommunication between myself and housekeeping. The next morning they were there bright and early. Note: they start cleaning the rooms very early -8am - If you remember to put out the "do not disturb sign" the night before - that is helpful if you sleep in. Great experience overall I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay for business at Indy”
Reviews.Author: Travelling-Argie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week during a business trip. It was my first time at a Wingate hotel and was fantastic. I booked a suite, very large room with a big comfortable bed and a great living room area. The bathroom was clean and nothing was missing. The location was perfect for a quick 10 minute drive to the office, very nice nearby area with lots of places to eat. Would definitively come back whenever I go to Indy for business.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back!!”
Reviews.Author: karrn64
Reviews.Content: Needed to be in the Indy area for my son to go to orientation at IUPUI. I spent a lot of time researching places to stay on a budget. This seemed to have the best reviews and certainly the most competitive price-especially since breakfast was included! This hotel did not disappoint!! The rooms are gorgeous and have recently been decorated. The hotel lobby, eating area and pool/hot tub areas were all very clean. I was surprised to be offered a free beer and popcorn when we arrived back from the campus for the evening. There were no surprises and the beds were very comfy. The hotel is just about 15 mins from downtown Indy-so close enough, but not congested like downtown and NO PARKING FEE!!! This is a great hotel for the money and it will be my go-to for the upcoming year when my son swims for the Jaguars!! There was a microwave and refridgerator which will come in very handy!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel all around. Service and on site amenities!”
Reviews.Author: kbwhitaker
Reviews.Content: I was going to be in Indianapolis for business and originally booked this hotel for 2 nights. Due to last minute flight delays I was unable to arrive that night. I was not able to arrive until the second night. My cancellation policy was 6pm so they had all the right to charge me for that first night. I called around midnight that first night and advised the front desk that due to flight delays I would not be arriving until the next day. They gladly cancelled the 1st night and did not charge me for it...GREAT! I finally got to the hotel the next day at around 12pm but their check in time was not until 3pm. I decided to see if I could check in early and they had no issues with that. After the 24 hour airline ordeal this meant the world to me. I went to my room (427) and was very pleased to find a very large and clean room. Also there were a couple of bottles of water on the table, not cold but nothing my fridge couldn't take care of. The bed was extremely comfortable! I then went down in the morning to get a coffee and could not help but notice the variety in their breakfast. I usually do not take advantage of the breakfasts (just coffee) at the hotels I stay at but I could not help but make myself a waffle. Lets just say I messed the waffle up and made a mess of the machine. The lady in the breakfast room was great and helped me clean it up. If the experience could not get any better, I noticed my flight out of Indy was not until 3:30pm. I went to the front desk and asked if there was anyway i could check out late and told him I did not need to go to the airport until 1:00pm. They had no issues with me checking out until 1pm...at no extra fee. The only thing this hotel is missing is an airport shuttle. Its about a $30 cab ride so work that into your expenses ($60 round trip) This is the first time I have ever stayed at a Wingate and from now on will always book Wingate if there is one in the area I am looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!!!”
Reviews.Author: zuponjen
Reviews.Content: The beds were great, and it was hard to get up at 3:30 to get ready for my early morning flight. My bill was ready for me in my door, and the girl working the desk not only had fresh coffee ready, she even came out and scraped my windows as I loaded my luggage! GREAT service!

Reviews.Title: “Outstand stay and service”
Reviews.Author: blossom1098
Reviews.Content: Hotel and staff went above the norm to make our stay exceptional. Great stay. Willstay always....

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Rustyb2b
Reviews.Content: Perfect. That is the only word I can think of to describe this hotel. The staff treated me like a an important person regardless of my "status" in their "rewards" program. I cannot stand when hotels all but ignore you to tend to their "special" guest. Just as a regular guest, I received free bottles of water and snack bars that were replinished every day of my 3 day stay. They gave away free beer! Let me repeat that, THEY GAVE ME FREE BEER!!! Apparently they give away drinks and snacks during the weekday evenings from 5-6 something. I will stay there every time I travel to Indianapolis, and I suggest anyone who reads this do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Decent business hotel”
Reviews.Author: sjk1976
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay in this particular Wyndham and it worked out well. About 20-25 minutes from the airport and about the same from downtown, it was convenient to business meetings I had in the area. Free Internet and wifi which I actually hate paying for at some of the more upscale chains. Also a free breakfast which is handy. The fitness room and pool - indoor - also cone in handy.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay. Very friendly employees. Great value for your dollar.”
Reviews.Author: BettyGreenBay
Reviews.Content: Very good place to stay. The Tuesday dinner and cocktails on the other evenings served by the Manager is just wonderful. She is very friendly. The rooms are ALWAYS clean and the heating/cooling system is perfect. The breakfast is good and hot plus varies from day to day. Very reasonable price-wise.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: evaluator
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night, July 26, when I had eye surgery. It was close & convenient. We had 2 adults & 4 children, & everyone was well pleased. The room was very nice, clean, & great beds. Refrigerator was handy, & we enjoyed the water bottles & granola bars as well as the popcorn, sodas & other drinks in the afternoon. The pool was wonderful, & the kids loved it, also the whirlpool. They even took a turn in the exercise room. The breakfast was excellent with plenty of choices to please our whole gang. The people were very kind & helpful, & there are nice eating places nearby. If we have to do this again, we will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a moderate price range.”
Reviews.Author: retired-teacher60
Reviews.Content: My husband and I usually stay at the Days Inn or Super 8, but since this was a longer trip and one where we might spend time in the hotel, we went a step up in the Wyndham group. This was a good move. The hotel was spotless. The room was spacious and nicely decorated. The exercise room was nice, though overheated. There was a nice business center with computer, printer, fax, etc. As an unexpected treat on weekdays except Tues., they serve beer and wine and popcorn starting around 5pm. On Tuesdays they had sandwiches, soup, potato chips, veggies and dip, fruit and cookies and brownies, plus the wine and beer! We skipped supper! If you get the chance be sure to go to the Indianapolis Speedway and visit the museum (only $5 with AAA). Also the Indianapolis Museum of Art is fantastic -- and free! We spent 2 days there!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: hbrumley
Reviews.Content: The room was fantastic, VERY clean and neat. The bedding was wonderful and the mattress made me wish I had one at home. We didn't know where to stay when we took our son to tour Lincoln College of Technology and this was recommended by his advisor. We now know the best place to stay! We will look for Wingates now when we travel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quiet and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: mnmonte
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here at least a dozen times over the past three years and have no reason to stay anywhere else when visiting Indianapolis. The staff is professional and personable. The large rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable with the convenience of a refrigerator and microwave. The freeway is only a block away making it very convenient to get around the northwest part of the city in just a few minutes (though the freeway is very, very close, the freeway noise is not heard from within the room). The only negative things we have run into: the hair dryer overloading at times and a room near the elevator in which the elevator could be heard in the room when in use.

Reviews.Title: “great price for high-end hotel quality”
Reviews.Author: dniswong
Reviews.Content: My family was very pleased with this motel's high quality beds, complimentary wifi and water/granola bars, and excellent continental breakfast selections. The property inside and out was very well maintained. This had the look and experience of a high end hotel for a mid-range price!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful home-away-from-home”
Reviews.Author: DragosD
Reviews.Content: Long term guest. Wonderful service, staff and rooms. I will always stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Thrilled with this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: sherjoer6
Reviews.Content: I just came home today from this fabulous hotel. Exceptional value, service and cleanliness. I was so impressed with the beautiful room, fully equipped with a luxurious bed, microwave, fridge and couch with coffee table. The location was perfect, it was a quieter area, although right off the highway and about a 10 minute ride to the speedway. Also very convenient to go downtown or the airport. The surrounding area is full of restaurants to choose from, About 4 of them share the same parking lot as the hotel. Brenda the very nice manager, hosts a manager's reception Mon-Thurs with free beer and wine and popcorn. Tuesdays they serve dinner, and every morning there is an exceptional hot continental breakfast. I would definitely choose this hotel again if staying in Indianapolis again!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms, clean, nice breakfast”
Reviews.Author: kk123
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at this location with 2 adults, 3 kids, and 1 dog. We found the room to be spacious and clean. Staff was very helpful. Walls were a little thin and you could hear people talking in hallways and walking above, wasn't enough to keep you awake. Pool was ok. Whirlpool had a strong chemical smell. Breakfast was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal - Very Happy with 3 day stay”
Reviews.Author: GFTraveler81
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here in late May as we came to Indy to visit family. Got a great deal and had two rooms. Very nice, newer hotel in a business area of town. Staff very nice. Great indoor pool, free breakfast including some hot items and free guest laundry. It was an easy 15 minute drive to downtown. We were very happy here and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Keep coming back!”
Reviews.Author: pitzel
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Wingate Indianapolis a number of times over the past year. I travel to Indianapolis on business frequently and this has become my "go-to" place to stay. The hotel is clean and comfortable, the staff is friendly and helpful, and there are a lot of added "perks" that you often do not find even at more expensive hotels. For one, the complementary bottled water and snack bars are a nice touch. There are fresh baked cookies in the lobby in the afternoon and evening. The hotel has free wi-fi and a small, but clean fitness room. There are free laundry facilities for guests and a laundry basket in each room to make it easier to take items there and back. Breakfast is complementary and includes hot items, though the array of foods could be wider (I am not one for breakfast, so I don't mind too much). My favorite perk, though, is the evening reception on most nights (check for closing hours), which is quite good! They offer beer and wine (a good selection of each, too), fresh fruit, and hot and cold appetizers. During my last stay at the hotel, the evening happy hour reception even included a full dinner! The weather was particularly cold and nasty and the hotel staff had made lasagna, salad, garlic bread, dessert and all of the fixings -- all at no charge. It seemed like they really went out of there way to make sure that all of their guests were comfortable and cared for, particularly on a night when one wouldn't want to fight the cold to go out to dinner. Any problems that I have had with the hotel (hot water runs out, TV doesn't work, etc.) have always been resolved promptly and curteously. Because of this, I keep coming back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally clean”
Reviews.Author: bamom91
Reviews.Content: This was one of the cleanest hotels I have ever stayed in. The rooms were spacious and included nice amenities such as a flat screen HDTV, a DVD player, complimentary water bottles and granola bars, refrigerator, plenty of sitting space, nice working area, and lots of room on the bathroom countertops. Breakfast offerings included fresh fruit, waffles, eggs, sausage, pastries/breads, cereal, yogurt, coffee, milk, and juice. We were originally assigned a room in which the heating/air conditioning unit wasn't working properly and were promptly reassigned a room across the hall without any hassle at all. I would definitely stay at this hotel if I ever have occasion to spend the night in Indianpolis again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Affordable, Comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: realitybytes
Reviews.Content: The Wingate Wyndham off of I-465 was a nice stay and was very affordable. The hotel appeared very clean and there was a continental breakfast with bagels and make-your-own belgian waffles. There is a cool office business center in the lobby where you can fax things for free, get on the computer and print out directions, and check your email. The pool looked clean although we didn't use it, the beds were comfortable, and the room was nice and open with a fridge, microwave, complimentary snacks and water. Very clean and we received an excellent rate.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased!”
Reviews.Author: Crotinger
Reviews.Content: Our visit to this hotel was wonderful. The entire hotel, including the room was VERY clean. Not one hair, stain, pest, etc. They had it nicely decorated inside and out. It was also in a good area (very important). The pool area was great, although the chlorine level was a bit high. The breakfast buffet was out of this world. They had everything from ham, eggs, waffles, fruit, danish, and everything was fresh. Hot food was hot, and cold food was cold. The staff were all friendly and attentive to our needs in a very timely manner. We were very happy with our stay here, and if we return to Indianapolis for any reason, we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable service”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTraveler3
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice, clean and convenient as others have mentioned, but what I thought was great about the Wingate was the service. The evening manager, Bruce, was so kind and helpful to us. And in the morning, the staff couldn't have been friendlier. The hotel is right off I-465, which is nice and convenient and next to a LePeep, Max & Erma's and across the street from a Wendy's.

Reviews.Title: “clean place overall great value”
Reviews.Author: lisa2travel
Reviews.Content: clean hotel, first time i stayed at a wingate. the staff was courteous.. little dissapointed in breakfast items that might have been cause they were busy and was not much left when we arrived

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value but bring a car...”
Reviews.Author: Pete B
Reviews.Content: Stayed here and used a taxi to get to the Convention Center. The hotel was really excellent. Breakfast was pretty good with fresh apples/bananas and yougurt was Danon. Complimentary bottled water and snake bars in room. Nice touch... Didn't use the indoor pool but it was certainly larger than most. There are 2 or 3 walkable restaurant/bar type places. Stick w/ Erma's across the parking lot. Not great food but not bad for a chain-like place. They even had fresh fish---which was okay. Everyone told us that it would only be $25 bucks to taxi to downtown. With tip it's really $35 to $40ish Next time I'll just book downtown or rent a car. I'd certainly stay here again though. Paid $105.00

Reviews.Title: “Very rough night at the Wingate Inn - Indianapolis Northwest”
Reviews.Author: cprussel
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel a month in advance based on the good reviews. Unfortunately this is where the word good ends. Let me preface this review with the fact that I am extremely allergic to cigarette smoke. I had called early in the day to confirm with the hotel that I would need late check in. They replied that I would be fine as I had confirmed the room with a credit card. I arrived at the hotel and checked in. I was comforted to see a sign on the hotel desk stating this is a non smoking facility. It is about 11PM and I am tired from the long drive. I checked in and proceeded to my room. Arriving at the elevator a couple gentlemen stated, “You are in for a real treat. The hotel is filled with a bunch of 12 year old girls and it is a zoo.” The hotel was filled with softball teams in town for a tournament. Arriving to our floor I walk down the hall to find my room. A group of parents and their children were sitting on the hallway floor being extremely loud. They continued to sit as we tried to maneuver around them with our luggage. I entered my room and the extreme smell of cigarette smoke hit me in the face. I called down to the desk and asked to change rooms. “I booked a non smoking room and the room reeks of smoke” I said. They proceeded to tell me that no other rooms were available. Nothing I said helped and nothing further was done to accommodate. I left the hotel to get some air freshener to try to make it bearable. The hotel is not in a nice part of the city we were a little nervous being out at the late hour in this area. I ended up sleeping with the window to the room open to make the air breathable for us. This helped only marginally and you can imagine how uncomfortable this made things as it was 20 degrees outside. At least now we could breathe some fresh air. It is now around midnight. The group of parents and children proceeded to do whatever it was they were doing in the hallway until about 1:30 AM and were very loud! Repeated calls to the front desk had no effect. Waking up with a sore throat and bloodshot eyes … I proceeded to the front desk. I requested a new room. I was still not able to switch rooms so I canceled the next nights stay and was forced to find another hotel. I was able to thank goodness! The hotel did credit the charge for the nights stay, but not willingly. I feel this was not enough for the night we had to endure. On the positive side the hotel was in decent condition and the free breakfast was good. The countless hotels I have stayed at over the years this is among the worst nights stay I have ever experienced. I will not be staying at this hotel ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Great, Great!!”
Reviews.Author: chi-towntraveler54
Reviews.Content: Absolute consistency! I've stayed at this hotel many times on business from Chicago. As mentioned in other reviews, as soon as you walk in you're impressed with the cleanliness of the property which extends from the public areas to the rooms. Additionally, all staff are most welcoming and very accomodating. The pool area is fab as is the very complete breakfast buffet. No regrets ever when choosing this Wingate. I only wish that it could be cloned in some of the other cities I travel to.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place”
Reviews.Author: Drummer46241
Reviews.Content: I was in Indianapolis for a training session and my company reserved rooms for several of us at this hotel. I was very pleased by the cleanliness of the hotel from the moment I stepped inside. The personnel working at this property were friendly, attentive, and assisted me with anything I needed while there for two nights. A small problem with the phone was quickly rectified by a patient gentleman who was exceptionally polite and respectful. The rooms are very nicely appointed. The bathroom was spotless and stocked with quality items. I found the bed to be very comfortable. It seems high from the floor, but once you're in, you're in! It is hard to leave - as it envelops you with softness and comfort. Parking was ample, the property is located very near restaurants, shopping, I-465 and I-65. I was able to get downtown within 20 minutes during rush hour and still had plenty of time to find parking for my training. Breakfast is served in a comfortable area off the lobby and was very well stocked. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: ser33
Reviews.Content: It's true what the other reviews say ... This place is a gem. It's clean! They're nice! And I really comfortable about camping out there for a few days. The pool was also well-maintained. They had chocolate chip cookies at the check-in desk and bottled water in the room. Nice touches for a place that runs like it should!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, and great value!”
Reviews.Author: Madwizard
Reviews.Content: Best things about this hotel: - large, clean rooms in like-new condition - free breakfast with 2 or 3 hot items (different each day), waffles, pastries, etc - microwave, fridge with small inner freezer, coffee maker, iron, safe - comfortable beds and pillows (though might be a bit too soft for some folks) - nice showers, and quality shampoo & conditioner - free wireless AND wired high-speed internet - free bottled water and granola bars - friendly service - nice neighborhood. Located just off highway 465 but far enough that I didn't hear any traffic noise. - great value: about $125 USD (incl taxes) in October 2007 Things I didn't like: - elevators are slow, especially the door opening/closing - towels are a bit rough I didn't use the business center, fitness room, pool, or whirlpool. In terms of comfort, this hotel is one of the best I've been to; in some ways even better than the MGM Grand in Vegas. The breakfast buffet was a big plus, as were the appliances in the room. I would definately reccommend this hotel to anyone who is visiting Indianapolis.

Reviews.Title: “Nice convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: Occasional-visitor
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for two days. It was convenient to the Indianapolis Motor Speedway --about 10-15 minutes away. The room was large and nicely furnished. Comfy bed and good shower. We enjoyed the free breakfast although you need to be early to get the cut fruit and it was only available the first day we were there. The make your own waffles were good. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Is this a budget hotel ?...Hard to believe!”
Reviews.Author: jpocccoc
Reviews.Content: In all my years of traveling, this hotel is one of the best deals I have ever come to find. The hotel is immaculate; it looks brand -new. Rooms are comfortable and have amenities usually offered only in high-end hotels: Coffee maker, fridge, microwave, desk and additional seating area. The complimentary in-room items were appreciated as well: free bottled water and granola bars (replinished daily), shampoo, conditioner, lotion, makeup remover cloths, shower cap, and sewing kit. Also, maid service was super. I cannot say enough good things about the management- they let our group watch a movie using their lobby surround-sound tv. Tuesday night's "managers reception" surpassed anything I have had even on the "club level" of upscale hotels: a variety of wines (served in real wine glasses, not plastic cups like many hotels - so tacky!), beer, and fantastic appetizers (including "Texas caviar"). The hotel is located in an area with dining / services available within walking distance: Max and Ermas, Le Peep, Quiznos, Starbucks, a bar, and nail salon. The Wingate backs up to a residential area which was great for evening runs. The only disappointment about this hotel is its fitness center. But, a nice alternative was being able to jog outside in a safe area. I will be returning to Indianapolis next summer , and I hope our group will be able to stay at this hotel again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Wingate We've Visited”
Reviews.Author: Baidoo
Reviews.Content: This is the nicest Wingate we've visited. The pool is perfect! Temperature and hot tub temps were also perfect. Our almost 4 yr. old had a great time as well. The extra snacks, water, sewing kit and amenities make this the nicest Wingate by far! Great place to stay while visiting the Children's Museum. We'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “I'll certainly stay here again”
Reviews.Author: RelivAmbassador
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 3 nights with 6 other people from my company when we were taking a class in Indy. This is one of the nicest hotels for the price I've ever stayed in. It's the ONLY hotel I've ever stayed in that provided free bottled water (2 bottles no less) and granola bars in the room. It is almost new, very clean and up to date. The location is very nice, being right beside a Le Peep breakfast restaurant (excellent), a Wendy's, a Max & Erma's and a Starbuck's for early in the morning quick starts. And if hotel breakfasts are your thing, you won't be disappointed with this one. The staff was wonderful! They were full of smiles and tried to help with any needs. They were very personable and accomodating. After our workshop and back at our company we did a debrief of our training trip. All 7 of us agreed that we will stay at this hotel in the future. I know I certainly will!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Spotless Wingate!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Exceptionally clean and well-kept room. Everything seemed brand new. Very friendly and accommodating staff. The pool and hot tub were also extrememly clean and appeared brand new. Very comfortable bed, mini fridge, microwave and complimentary coffee, bottled water and granola bars made our stay more homey. Also the breakfast buffet was hot and delicious. Would highly reccommend this wonderful hotel!

HotelInfo.Name: Wingate by Wyndham Indianapolis Northwest
HotelInfo.Address: 6240 InTech Commons Dr, Indianapolis, IN 46278
